summary: This document is a chain of emails from March 2021 regarding the planning of a virtual sexual assault prevention conference. An attorney from Edwards Pottinger LLC is invited to present a workshop using the Jeffrey Epstein case as a case study for litigating sexual abuse and human trafficking cases.

persons.name: Esq. Staff Attorney
persons.role: Staff Attorney at Crime Victims Center
persons.context: Staff attorney from the Crime Victims Center organizing the 'Enough is Enough' Sexual Assault Conference, coordinating with the FBI and the speaker.

persons.name: Trial Attorney
persons.role: Trial Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC
persons.context: Attorney invited to present a workshop at the conference on litigating sexual abuse and human trafficking cases, using the Jeffrey Epstein case as a case study.

persons.name: Coordinator of Support Services
persons.context: Individual responsible for putting the conferences together, mentioned in the email chain.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His case is referenced as the proposed case study for a workshop on litigating sexual abuse and human trafficking cases at the conference.

connections.description: Conference organizer inviting and coordinating with a speaker for a workshop.
Attorney's proposed presentation uses the Epstein case as a legal case study.

events.title: 2021 Suffolk County Campus Sexual Assault Prevention 'Enough is Enough' Conference
events.description: A virtual conference held via Zoom featuring workshops on sexual assault prevention, including a proposed workshop on litigating sexual abuse cases using the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: An attorney from Edwards Pottinger LLC was invited to present at a 2021 sexual assault prevention conference.
The attorney's proposed workshop topic was litigating sexual abuse and human trafficking cases using the Jeffrey Epstein case as a case study.
The conference was organized by the Crime Victims Center and was to be held virtually on April 15, 2021.
The email chain shows FBI personnel were copied on the correspondence regarding the conference planning.
